item.description: This panorama shows a lowrider show and concert in Tucson, Ariz. Photos by Deanna Dent.
Fans let loose during a performance of "Baby Bash" during the lowrider car show and concert in Tucson. The band plays a combination of Hip Hop and R&B.
A lowrider car is displayed at a show in Tucson. Lowriders originated in Mexican-American communities in Los Angeles County, but their popularity has spread around the world.
A visitor to the lowrider show is reflected in the rim of a Ford 150 truck.
"Baby Bash" poses for photos with young fans at the lowrider car show in Tucson.
Concert-goers at the lowrider car show wait for a performance to start.

Admirers view the interior of a lowrider car. The term "lowrider" originates from "low riding," as the vehicles ride low to the ground. Lowriders have become a part of the urban youth culture, particularly on the West coast.
The music is almost as much of a draw as the cars at the lowrider car show in Tucson.
A little boy is held by his mom as she sings along with Baby Bash at the lowrider car show in Tucson, Ariz. Baby Bash and other artists played a concert at the show as well. Photo by Deanna Dent
A concert-goer wears a T-shirt displaying an image of the Virgin of Guadalupe. The lowrider culture, like the Virgin, is popular among many Mexican-Americans.
